units.title: Lentiviral transduction of hiPSCs with FLP under CDH1 promoter
units.text: hiPSCs were transduced with a lentiviral vector encoding FLP under the control of the CDH1 promoter at day 15 before analysis at day 24.
units.rationale: To induce FLP expression for lineage tracing at a specific developmental stage.

units.title: 4‑hydroxytamoxifen treatment at JCF stage
units.text: 4‑hydroxytamoxifen (4‑OHT) was applied at the beginning of the JCF stage (days 7–8; Fig. 4e and Extended Data Fig. 8a).
units.rationale: To activate inducible FLP recombinase for labeling of JCF progenitors.

units.title: Detection of HA‑tag+CDH1+ cells after 72 h
units.text: After 72 h, we detected HA-tag+CDH1+ cells, indicating correct labeling of the mesothelial layer (Extended Data Fig. 9b).
units.rationale: To confirm successful recombination and labeling of the mesothelial layer.

units.title: Immunofluorescence analysis of HA‑tag+ cells at day 24
units.text: On day 24, immunofluorescence analysis revealed HA-tag+ SMCs and fibroblasts but also CMs (Fig. 5b, Supplementary Video 3 and Extended Data Fig. 9c).
units.rationale: To assess the differentiated fates of labeled cells.

units.title: Generation of FLP/FRT‑based hiPSC reporter line
units.text: We generated an hiPSC reporter line in which a flippase (FLP) recognition target (FRT)-flanked neomycin cassette (mKate2) fused to a hemagglutinin (HA) tag was knocked into the AAVS1 safe harbor locus49 (Supplementary Results and Supplementary Fig. 4a–f).
units.rationale: To create a stable reporter system for lineage tracing.

units.title: Lentiviral transduction for JCF lineage tracing
units.text: For JCF lineage tracing, epicardioids from this reporter line were transduced with a lentiviral vector encoding FLP (FLPERT2) under the control of the MAB21L2 promoter at day 3, and 4‑hydroxytamoxifen (4‑OHT) was applied at the beginning of the JCF stage (days 7–8; Fig. 4e and Extended Data Fig. 8a).
units.rationale: To specifically label JCF progenitors for fate mapping.

units.title: ISL1 immunostaining in human fetal heart tissue
units.text: We performed ISL1 immunostaining in human fetal heart tissue to verify that epicardial cells were indeed positive for ISL1 (Supplementary Fig. 3b).
units.rationale: To validate ISL1 expression in human epicardial cells.

units.title: Subclustering of metacell dataset to investigate fate decisions
units.text: We performed subclustering of the metacell dataset to investigate the timing of fate decisions of JCF progenitors as seen in the mouse (Fig. 4f).
units.rationale: To resolve distinct cell states and their differentiation trajectories.

units.title: Application of CellRank for macrostates inference
units.text: CellRank47 was used to infer the terminal macrostates (myocytic, epicardial, endothelial and endodermal) and the probability of each cell to transition toward these states based on both pseudotime and RNA velocity.
units.rationale: To predict differentiation outcomes and transition probabilities.

units.title: Integration of transcriptome and chromatin data via metacells
units.text: We integrated the two modalities by constructing metacells containing both transcriptome and chromatin accessibility information, defining a total of 24 clusters from 35,499 metacells (Fig. 4a and Supplementary Table 3).
units.rationale: To combine multi‑omic data for comprehensive cell type identification.
